rossbyplots module¶

Graphics module¶

Functions for different plots such as scatterplots and mapplots, initiation and configuration of figure objects etc

Created: Autumn 2016 Authors: Petter Lind & David Lindstedt

rossbyplots.axes_settings(ax, figtitle, xlabel, ylabel, xtlabels=None, ytlabels=None, xticks=None, yticks=None, xlim=None, ylim=None)[source]¶

Configuration of axes; titles and labels

ax: axes object
Axes object assoicated with figure
figtitle: string
The headtitle
xlabel, ylabel: strings
Labels of the axes
xticks, yticks: lists or arrays
If set, location of ticks
xtlabels, ytlabels: lists or arrays
Contains tick labels (corresponding to ticks location)
xlim, ylim: lists or arrays
Limits of the axes
rossbyplots.figure_setup(figsize=(12, 12), plottype='lineplot', printtypes=False)[source]¶

Setting up a figure object

figsize: tuple
Size of figure in inches; (width, height)
plottype: string
Type of plot to make
printtypes: boolean
If available plottypes should be printed on screen

Set up the plot axes using mpl_toolkits.ImageGrid

Examples of **kwargs with default values:
direction=”row”, axes_pad=0.02, add_all=True, share_all=False, label_mode = “L”, aspect=True, cbar_mode=None, cbar_location=’right’, cbar_size=”5%”, cbar_pad=None,
rossbyplots.make_legend(ax, labels, loc=0, fontsize='large', ncol=2, sc_points=1, num_points=1)[source]¶

Adds legend to plot

ax - Axes object of figure labels - String or list of strings; labels of legend items loc - Location of legend; default 0 (‘best’) fontsize - Fontsize of labels ncol - Number of columns for multiple legend items sc_points - Number of points in legend for scatterplot num_points - Number of points in legend for line plot
legend: legend object

rossbyplots.mapprod(grid, lat, lon, proj='stere', lon_0=None, lat_0=None, lat_ts=None, lat_1=None, lat_2=None, res='i', zoom='crnrs', zoom_geom=None, area_thrs=1000)[source]¶

Create a basemap object to be used in the overlaying of 2d plots.

lat: array
array of the latitudes
lon: array
array of the longitudes
proj: string
the projection to be used (so far only two proj’s: sterographic and lambert conformal)
lat_0/lon_0: float
centre latitude and longitude location of map
lat_1: float
first standard parallell. if proj=’lcc’, lat_1 must be given.
lat_2: float
second standard parallell (defaults to lat_1). if proj=’lcc’, lat_1 must be given.
res: string
resolution (low ‘l’, intermediate ‘i’ or high ‘h’)
zoom: string
“cornrs” or “geom”, how to set the extent of map
area_thrs: float
threshold area (default 1000 km2), under which objects are not shown on map.
m: Basemap object
map object
coords: list
list containing x,y arrays of the transformed longitudes to map coordinates
